required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 4 vs 7 Points Blood Glucose Monitoring in Gestational Diabetes on Dietary Modification
clinical_study.official_title: 4 Versus 7 Points Self-monitoring Blood Glucose in Gestational Diabetes on Diet Modification-A Randomised Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to compare between 4 and 7 points blood glucose monitoring in women with gestational diabetes on diet modification.

detailed_description.textblock: All women with gestational diabetes on diet modification will be recruited and randomised to 4 versus 7 points self monitoring blood glucose. They will be followed up 4 weekly and the pregnancy outcomes will be evaluated.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All women with gestational diabetes are randomised to 4 or 7 points of self monitoring blood glucose.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean gestational age at delivery in weeks

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation and participants are diagnosed in established labour
primary_outcome.description: Rate of spontaneous or induced labour in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation when the participants had given birth to the newborn
primary_outcome.description: Rate of vaginal, instrumental or caesarean delivery in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation during progress of labour up to 24 hours post delivery
primary_outcome.description: Rate of intrapartum complications such as postpartum haemorrhage, shoulder dystocia and third or fourth degree tear in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of birth of the neonate
primary_outcome.description: Mean neonatal birth weight in kilogram

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of birth of the neonate
primary_outcome.description: Rate of neonates born with Apgar score at five minutes of less than 7 in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of birth of the neonate
primary_outcome.description: Rate of neonatal intensive care unit admission in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation up to 7 days after birth of the neonate
primary_outcome.description: Rate of neonatal complications such as intrauterine fetal demise, neonatal death, neonatal hypoglycaemia, neonatal jaundice, neonatal respiratory distress syndrome and neonatal sepsis in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation
primary_outcome.description: Mean age of participants in years

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of each different races such as Malay, Chinese and Indian in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of parity such as nulliparous or multiparous in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation based on the first trimester weight documented in the antenatal record
primary_outcome.description: Mean prepregnancy body mass index in kg/m^2

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean total weight gain in kilogram

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of positive family history of diabetes mellitus in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of previous pregnancy affected by gestational diabetes mellitus in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of previous pregnancy complicated by fetal macrosomia in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean gestational age gestational diabetes mellitus is diagnosed in weeks

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean fasting glucose level from the modified glucose tolerance test in mmol/l

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean two hours post 75 gram glucose load from the modified glucose tolerance test in mmol/l

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of antenatal complications such as preeclampsia, threatened preterm labour, preterm prelabour rupture of membranes, anaemia,

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean level of glycosylated haemoglobin in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean level of serum fructosamine in percentage

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean level of fasting blood glucose in self monitoring blood glucose in mmol/l

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean level of pre-meal blood glucose in self monitoring blood glucose in mmol/l

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
primary_outcome.description: Mean level of one hour post-meal blood glucose in self monitoring blood glucose in mmol/l

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of randomisation up to 40 weeks gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Mean gestational age that the participants are detected to require added treatment in weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of type of treatment needed such as oral hypoglycaemic agent only, combination of insulin and oral hypoglycaemic agent

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of frequency of four weekly self blood glucose monitoring in percentage

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From point of randomisation till 40 weeks gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of participants' satisfaction whether satisfied, neutral or not satisfied in percentage

arm_group.description: 4 points of self monitoring blood glucose which comprises of fasting, 1 hour post breakfast, 1 hour post lunch and 1 hour post dinner
7 points of self monitoring blood glucose which comprises of fasting,1 hour post breakfast, 1 hour pre and post lunch, 1 hour pre and post dinner, pre bed at 10 pm

intervention.description: Patients with gestational diabetes will be seen by the dietitian to be taught diet modification

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18-45 years old
- Pregnant women with gestational diabetes mellitus on diet modification
- Confirmed gestational diabetes mellitus using National Institute for Health and Care Excellence guideline by 75g oral glucose tolerance test after 14 weeks
- Gestational age at recruitment 20-34 week
Exclusion Criteria:
- bad obstetrics history.
- Women with underlying medical disorders such as hypertension, autoimmune diseases on steroids
- fetal anomaly.
- Women planning to deliver in other centres
- Women who refuse to participate

patient_data.ipd_description: The IPD will only be shared upon request. The data that can be shared will be the blood glucose levels and pregnancy outcomes.
